text: Not all heroes wear capes. Happy Father‚Äôs Day to all the kind  loving and courageous fathers out there. Thank you for your unconditional love and support. ‚ù§Ô∏èIf you are caring for a loved one with a mental health condition  know that you are not alone - CAL is here to walk with you  no matter how tough the journey may be.#EmpoweringHiddenHeroes#CAL4MentalWellness

The journey of a caregiver to a family member  relative or friend with mental health issues is long and challenging.Join our upcoming fully-funded Caregivers-to-Caregivers Training Programme (C2C) and learn how to:-  Increase your understanding of mental illnesses and how they are treated;-  Improve your communication skills with your loved ones;-  Use the power of empathy in caregiving.Sign up now for our June ‚Äì July 2021 classes here:https://www.cal.org.sg/c2cFind more information about Caregivers here:https://www.cal.org.sg/am-i-a-caregiver#EmpoweringHiddenHeroes#CAL4MentalWellness

The journey of a caregiver is long and challenging. If you know of any caregiver to a family member  relative or friend with mental health issues  please encourage him/her to attend our upcoming Caregivers-to-Caregivers Training Programme (C2C) to understand his/her loved one‚Äôs condition better and learn to become a more resilient caregiver.Content Highlights:- Increase your understanding of mental illnesses and how they are treated;- Improve your communication skills with your loved ones;- Use the power of empathy in caregiving.Sign up now for our July ‚Äì August 2021 classes here:https://www.cal.org.sg/c2cFind more information about Caregivers here:https://www.cal.org.sg/am-i-a-caregiver

Join us for our Trauma Informed Care (TIC) Workshop for Parents and Caregivers on 17 & 24 July 2021. This workshop will help you learn how to integrate trauma informed care into your interactions with children and youths.Content Highlights:1. What trauma entails2. Trauma informed approaches3. Implementation of trauma informed care; and4. Healing and recoveryRegister for this workshop athttp://tiny.cc/ticworkshop.Zoom details will be shared to the participants after the registration deadline.

Join us for our third Fireside Chat with Mr Jackie Tay  Executive Director  PSALT Care Limited. He will share the principles of Wellness Recovery Action Planning¬Æ (WRAP¬Æ) and how caregivers can apply WRAP¬Æ to better support their loved ones in their recovery journeys.Register for the session athttps://tinyurl.com/cal-firesidechat-eZoom details will be emailed to all participants by 16 July 2021  Friday.For more information  visithttps://www.cal.org.sg/post/fireside-chat-03-an-overview-of-wellness-recovery-action-planning-wrap

Join us for our Trauma Informed Care (TIC) Awareness Talk on 6 or 13 August 2021 to learn about what trauma is  its prevalence in Singapore  how it affects our children and youth  and how to integrate trauma-informed care into your work and life. This workshop is complimentary for parents  teachers  young adults  and social service professionals.Register for this awareness talk athttp://tiny.cc/tictalkZoom details will be shared to the participants after the registration deadline.

Join us for our Trauma Informed Care (TIC) Workshop for Parents and Caregivers on 21 & 28 August 2021. This workshop will help you learn how to integrate trauma informed care into your interactions with children and youths.Content Highlights:1. What trauma entails2. Trauma informed approaches3. Implementation of trauma informed care; and4. The journey of a caregiver to a family member  relative or friend with mental health issues is long and challenging.Join our upcoming fully-funded Caregivers-to-Caregivers Training Programme (C2C) and learn how to:-  Increase your understanding of mental illnesses and how they are treated;-  Improve your communication skills with your loved ones;-  Use the power of empathy in caregiving.Sign up now for our July ‚Äì August 2021 classes here:https://www.cal.org.sg/c2cFind more information about Caregivers here:https://www.cal.org.sg/am-i-a-caregiver#EmpoweringHiddenHeroes#CAL4MentalWellness

Loneliness is one of the main indicators of social well-being. Loneliness can lead to various psychiatric and physical disorders. If left unattended  loneliness can have serious consequences for mental and physical health. It can be challenging to maintain relationships because people didn‚Äôt understand or didn‚Äôt want to take the time to understand.Know of a friend  relative or colleague who might be caring for someone with a mental health condition or dementia? Share with them about our fully-funded C2C programmes athttps://www.cal.org.sg/c2c#EmpoweringHiddenHeroes#CAL4MentalWellness

Hello! I am Huang Hung Yu  writing on behalf of a group of Y5 students from Raffles Institution. We are conducting research onstress experienced by informal working caregivers.We would appreciate if you could help us by filling up this survey so we can gain a deeper understanding of the relationship between work and caregiver stress! All responses will be kept anonymous.If you have any questions  please feel free to contact me!THANK YOU ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòÑü§©Link to survey:https://tinyurl.com/workingcaregiverstress

Selamat Hari Raya Haji to all our Muslim Friends! As we celebrate the end of Hajj  CAL would like to thank all caregivers who have been pouring their hearts and souls into caring and supporting their loved ones.If you are a caregiver to a loved one with a mental health condition or dementia  CAL is here to support you! ‚ù§Ô∏èVisitwww.cal.org.sgto find out more#EmpoweringHiddenHeroes#CAL4MentalWellness

Are you a caregiver for someone at home? Amidst this COVID-19 pandemic  we understand the multitude of stresses and arduous journeys that caregivers may have experienced.This year National Day 2021  Care Connect championed by SG Assist is on a Caregiver Appreciation Campaign having partnered with various retail brands to offer rewards and benefits for you as a caregiver to extend appreciation and support for your hard work at caregiving.Be sure to check out our Care Connect website athttps://careconnect.sg/our-partners/to get your hands on these deals made specially for you as a caregiver!Join the Care Connect Family today as a member viahttps://careconnectmarketplace.webflow.io/membership.

The journey of a caregiver is long and challenging. If you know of any caregiver to a family member  relative or friend with mental health issues  please encourage him/her to attend our upcoming Caregivers-to-Caregivers Training Programme (C2C) to understand his/her loved one‚Äôs condition better and learn to become a more resilient caregiver.Content Highlights:- Increase your understanding of mental illnesses and how they are treated;- Improve your communication skills with your loved ones;- Use the power of empathy in caregiving.Classes are usually conducted in the evenings  but due to shifting schedules  the 12-week programme will now be available on Monday afternoons from 3pm to 5.30pm  starting 30 August 2021.Sign up now for our August 2021 classes here:https://www.cal.org.sg/c2cFind more information about Caregivers here:https://www.cal.org.sg/am-i-a-caregiver

CAL wishes everyone a Happy National Day! Although we‚Äôre still in Phase 2 heightened alert (P2HA)  let us stay positive and continue to support each other. May this day remind us to be united as one nation :-) Stay home  and stay safe!
Have a blessed National Day Singapore üá∏üá¨

Join us for our fourth Fireside Chat with Dr Adriana Banozic  trained Psychologist and Neuroscientist. She will share about how Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) can help us improve our quality of life by changing our thinking patterns and behaviours  and by taking control of our perceptions of circumstances.This Fireside Chat is recommended for anyone who wishes to learn how to deal with pain in a different way via CBT.Register for the session athttps://tinyurl.com/cal-firesidechat-eZoom details will be emailed to all participants by 24 August 2021  Tuesday.For more information  visithttps://www.cal.org.sg/post/fireside-chat-04-cognitive-behavioural-approaches-in-managing-pain

With eating disorders  early intervention is crucial. If you are caring for someone with an eating disorder  sign up for CAL's C2C Eating Disorder Programme  starting 2 Sept here:https://tinyurl.com/C2C-eatingdisorderThe rate of eating disorders among in Singapore is rising. Prevalent in both males and females  they can occur at any weight or body type. To learn about the common types of eating disorders  such as Anorexia Nervosa  Bulimia Nervosa  & Binge Eating Disorder (BED)  visithttps://www.eatingdisorderhope.com/information/eating-disorder?fbclid=IwAR06m9BnuBsZEKTs1AvNvtSaOjbMw48ZGaJk-x5hZA42L3MlsDApo-D7NB8

Good morning and happy Wednesday ‚ò∫Ô∏è I‚Äôm Claudine and I‚Äôm an NUS student conducting a study on caregiving in SingaporeIf you are a caregiver of an individual with mental illness  and are willing to be interviewed  please feel free to contact me@cloudineee.You may also fill in the form ontinyurl.com/care-interview-2021to indicate your interest and willingness to participate ‚ò∫Ô∏èIt‚Äôll be an hour-long session (max) and there‚Äôll be a token of appreciation (a $10 voucher) upon conclusion of the interview.Thank you so much for your time and please do not hesitate to contact me for any questions or clarifications üåª

If you are a caregiver to a family member  relative or friend with a mental health condition  C2C is the programme for you. Our C2C programme is fully-funded and open to everyone. Let us help you on this long and challenging journey.Note: The class held at Tzu Chi Humanistic Youth Centre is for those caring for youths aged between 15-35 years old.Do also join us for our Trauma Informed Care (TIC) Awareness Talk and Workshop for Parents and those caring for children.Sign up here:‚Ä¢http://www.cal.org.sg/c2c‚Ä¢http://tiny.cc/ticworkshop‚Ä¢http://tiny.cc/TICawarenesstalkSwipe to view our C2C and TIC schedule for September 2021 üóì

Hello! Life+ is a pilot initiative by the Inclusive Living Project Office set up by MINDS to support community living for adult persons with intellectual disabilities (PWID). With the right amount of supports in place  we are championing for PWIDs and their families to live and age well in their communities.We hope caregivers like you can join us by sharing your hopes and experiences for your child/ sibling with ID by completing an online survey!This survey will take about 15min. Your honest views will give us greater insights into the barriers and enablers of community living for PWIDs. This helps MINDS and gov agencies to plan better for the future of PWIDs. All info will be kept confidential. Link to survey:https://forms.office.com/r/fbYKDMqbRgIf you have any questions about the survey  you may email them tomi@minds.org.sg.

I‚Äôm sharing this study on behalf of a social worker friend who is doing a research study on Borderline Personality Disorder & Its Impact on the Family.---If you are a family member/caregiver to a person with Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD)  please be a part of this study. Your experiences as a family member are important  and as a social worker  she hopes to be able to better understand the impact this condition has on families in the hope of contributing towards enhanced support services and systems. Please refer to the attached file for more information.To register as a participant  please fill in the form:https://forms.gle/Y17kKz5zHNabwrq16Thank you.
Borderline Personality Disorder & Its Impact on the Family Research Study by Renay Pereira.pdf

Hi everyone! I recently joined a ground-up that provides a free virtual platform for Singaporeans to:1. Speak and share their struggles 1:1 in a safe  confidential space with a trained listener2. Get life or career guidance from experienced individuals coming from a range of diverse backgroundsIt's been a month and we've already engaged in quite the number of conversations! We are still expanding our base of volunteer listeners ("Hear Buds") and mentors ("Life Guides").It's our aim to plug the gaps in Mental Wellbeing by giving people a free space to connect  be listened to  and most importantly  be their real selves without the fear of judgment or stigma.If you:1. Would like a listening ear 2. Are looking for some life or career guidance  or3. Would like to find out more or join the teamCheck us out athttps://www.itallstartshear.sg/and do help us to share üôÇ thanks!

Join our panel of caregivers and persons-in-recovery at CAL‚Äôs first Chinese-language Fireside Chat. Hear both sides of the story as they recall the highs and lows that they have experienced on their individual journeys  how they have learnt to cope and what they hope for the future.Register for the session athttps://tinyurl.com/cal-firesidechat-cZoom details will be emailed to all participants by 23 September 2021  Thursday .For more information  visithttps://www.cal.org.sg/post/fireside-chat-c-01-strength-in-supporting-a-loved-one-in-recovery

Hi caregivers  we are a group of students from NYJC conducting a survey on stress of informal caregivers in Singapore. Please help us answer these questions as part of our research. Your responses will be kept anonymous and confidential. Thank you for your participation!https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSffqSjbnaSnvv-BY8MSIUODbL43gbqPagqYlAklEv8UAiT5dQ/viewform

Hi everyone  I'm Josh from Saint Andrew's Junior College. My Project Work group and I are currently doing research an 'A' Level project regarding stroke. We have two surveys: one for stroke patients and one for the caregiver of the mentioned stroke patient. If you're a caregiver to a stroke survivor  we'd be really appreciate if you could help us out by responding to both surveys. Please be assured that all responses will be kept private and confidential. Thank you!Here are the links:Caregiver Survey -https://forms.gle/kD6ak5AmP3djaoLU7Stroke Patient Survey -https://forms.gle/9KqgD1EPXcr9Awxg8
Would u like me to share with other caregivers whom I know to participate in the survey form too?
Yes please  that would be greatly appreciated!
Are we allowed to post an event for the community in this chat?
Gd morn. Thank u for sharing :)

Hi I‚Äôm Jane Koe from Singapore National Stroke Association. We are launching SOFS21 ( Stepping Up For Stroke ) tomorrow ( 2nd October ) virtually and registration is still opened if any one would like to participate . No registration fee is required. This year‚Äôs theme is ‚Äústart now‚Äù and we hope to raise $100 000. Click the following if u would to participate :http://sofs.snsa.org.sg. You can also visit our website atsnsa.org.sgto know more abt SNSA and the stroke communityüòä
SNSA just launched Stepping Out For Stroke ( SOFS21 ‚ÄúStartNow‚Äù thus morning virtually with Guest Of Honour  Mr Chee Hon Tat. More details on link . üòä

Hi  my name is Aloysius fromVintageRadio.SGMy apologies if I am going about this incorrectly.As Seniors are now encouraged to stay home  their mental well being will likely be further challenged.VintageRadio.SGwas created specifically to help alleviate that. Nostalgic music in 4 National languages (including dialect) and familar voices of Brian Richmond  Patrick ÈÉ≠Ë¥§Âçé  PN Bala and Rahimah Rahim to help put the smile on the faces of our seniors and help them re-live fond and happt memories.We have created simple sharing messages that will make it easy for Seniors to share amongst themselves and to download the free apps. Hope you will find these useful.Any of these following links can be copied and shared individually.Sharing is caring. While you stay home  stay connected by listening to your favorite nostalgic hits. Join us for our next Fireside Chat with Dr Rinkoo Ghosh  Facilitator/Trainer/Consultant with The Resilience Institute (South East Asia). She will share the challenges faced by caregivers who may be experiencing empathetic distress and how to manage their own emotions when dealing with others.Register for the session athttps://tinyurl.com/cal-firesidechat-eZoom details will be emailed to all participants by 13 October 2021  Wednesday.For more information  visithttps://www.cal.org.sg/post/fireside-chat-staying-empathic-without-too-much-suffering-am-i-ready-to-bounce-back

We have the first runners up of Talentime 1978 as our weekend Warriors today. They will also be singing 2 medleys during the show. The program airs on VintageRadioSG at 10am on today and is repeated Sunday at 4pm.

Todays is#worldmentalhealthday2021. Do your part to help Seniors alleviate the mental stress brought about by#isolation. Introduce them to VintageRadioSG  a digital channel for#seniors. Better still help them download the app or bookmark the player.  The links to various options are on this link.https://www.vintageradio.sg/#/list/apps?lang=en. You can also copy this link and share via What's App Chat Groups and other chat platforms. PM us if you want to share in Chinese  Malay or Tamil. BTW  you can also "Listen Live" from our FB page.
Wishing all a fruitful and peaceful day ahead
Thank you fir your sharing and will certainly share with my senior friends ( am one of the seniors too)üíñ

Singapore National Stroke  Association is celebrating its 25th anniversary with a Virtual Charity Dinner on 4 December as part of its fund raising campaign. For caregivers who are looking after stroke survivors  we welcome them to join our Caregivers‚Äô Support Group  especially if you are a first time new caregiver. Do contact SNSA office if you are interested to join us. We look forward to welcoming you and journey with you üòä
Anyone knows someone needs this. Do pm ASAP

CAL wishes a Happy Deepavali to all!üïØÔ∏èMay this Festival of Lights bring you peace and joy  and the strength to carry on no matter how dark the journey ahead may seem. ‚ú®Send this to a special someone to let them know you're thinking of them  and please reach out for support if you need it. You don't have to walk alone. ‚ù§Ô∏è#CALSingapore

‚ôªÔ∏èüíö The 3Rs in Sustainable Caregiving ‚Äì Regulating  Resourcing  ReflectingBrought to you by AWWA CREST and Care Corner Insight  the community mental health agencies of elderly and youth respectively  and both of us serving Northern Singapore.Signup link:www.bit.ly/novembercaregiverZoom Link will be sent to you after you sign up.Let's learn about the 3Rs of Sustainable Caregiving!What happens when we find it difficult to Regulate our emotions as a caregiver?Why do i feel so stretched with little Resources when i caregive for my elder or youth loved one?How can i find meaning to caregive and why must i do Reflection as a caregiver?Join us for this 3-week event  on Saturdays of November 2021  at 10am.Open to all  and especially caregivers of elderly &/oryouth with mental health concerns.Week 1:üíöTALK 1 - REGULATING EMOTIONS‚ÄúHow can we better regulate our difficult emotions?‚ÄùSpeaker:Ms Bettina Yeap(Care Corner INSIGHT)üóìÔ∏è Date: 6 Nov 2021 (Sat)üïôüï¶ Time: 10am - 11.30amWeek 2:‚ûøTALK 2 - REDEFINING RESOURCES‚ÄúWhat resources do we have  who and where can we go to for help and support?‚ÄùSpeaker:Mr Nicodemus Ching(AWWA CREST)üóìÔ∏è Date: 13 Nov 2021 (Sat)üïôüï¶ Time: 10am - 1130amWeek 3:üå†PANEL DISCUSSION ‚Äì ENGAGING IN REFLECTIVE PRACTICE‚ÄúHow can we find purpose and meaning in caregiving?‚ÄùPanelists:Ms Lim Si Huan (IMH) & Ms Bettina Yeap (Care Corner INSIGHT)üóìÔ∏è Date: 20 Nov 2021 (Sat)üïôüï¶ Time: 10am -11:30am

Catch our caregiver volunteer Nadia Daeng in Altered Lives  a 4-part documentary series that follows the lives of four individuals from Philippines  India  China and Singapore  as circumstances bring tumultuous changes to their lives.Among the featured individuals  Nadia  a CAL volunteer since 2016  shares the challenges of being a full-time caregiver to her mother who suffered a stroke and was subsequently diagnosed with vascular dementia. Forced to give up a successful marketing career  Nadia finds respite in supporting fellow caregivers in her role as a volunteer trainer. She was an integral part of the ‚ÄòReconnect with Caregivers‚Äô project where she checked in on how fellow caregivers were coping during the pandemic.Nadia‚Äôs story is telecast across the four episodes and CAL will be featured in the final episode on 27 Nov.Watch Altered Lives at Saturdays  9pm on CNA  or click here:https://www.channelnewsasia.com/watch/altered-lives

Hi everyone! Nice to meet all of you! I‚Äôm from Inclus and we help people with disabilities to find gainful employment and independence living.We have an upcoming training in December 2021 for people with disabilities looking for employment. This  training focuses on placing PWDs into office/admin job roles. Let me know if anyone may be interested and I will reach out to you todayüòäüòä
